doc.after: In September 1919 the Army Air Service decided that it needed an organized designation sequence and adopted fifteen classifications designated by Roman numerals Several other unnumbered designations were added later Each designation was assigned an abbreviation and each design a number within that abbreviation Variants were designated by alphabetically appending letters to the design number
